business.headline: HAL share price falls 4% after Tejas fighter jet crash at Dubai AirshowThe HAL stock slipped to around Rs 4,430, down roughly 3.6% at 10:44 am. Earlier in the day, the stock had tumbled over 8%.

Sensex, Nifty start week on a positive note as IT stocks lead the chargeBroader market indices were also in the green, mirroring the positive start. The tone was set by IT heavyweights: Tech Mahindra and Infosys jumped over 2% each, followed closely by gains in HCLTech and Wipro. Eicher Motors also featured among the early winners.

TCS suffers legal setback in US with $194 million penalty upheldThe matter has now been sent back to the Northern District of Texas, Dallas Division, which has been asked to review the injunction as per the directions of the Appeals Court.

Explained: Why billionaire Lakshmi Mittal is saying goodbye to the UKAs per the Forbes rich list, Mittal has a net worth of $21.4 billion. He is the 12th richest Indian and the 104th richest person in the world.

New labour codes: 10 key changes every employee should knowWhether someone works full-time, on a contract, or in sector-specific roles like media, plantations or factories, the new framework affects nearly everyone. Here are the key updates workers should be aware of, along with several other important changes that haven't received enough attention.

Feel cheated by your family will? Know your legal rightsWhether it is a sudden change in beneficiaries, unequal division of property, or doubts about the person's mental state when the will was written, such situations often create confusion, anger, and emotional stress.

Want to clear your home loan early? Simple ways to pay it off quicklyPay low EMIs and your tenure stretches, increasing your interest costs. Pay higher EMIs, and you could save years and lakhs on the total interest you pay.

New labour codes are here: Will your in-hand salary rise or fall?With the new labour codes now implemented, many employees are trying to understand what it means for their salary structure, especially basic salary, PF deductions and take-home pay.

New labour codes: What changes for paid leave, work hours and health benefitsThe new labour codes apply across sectors and are designed to improve safety, reduce fatigue and make workplaces more predictable for millions of workers in India.

Gratuity in a year? Only if you're a fixed-term employee. Here's what it meansOnly employees hired on fixed-term contracts qualify for the new one-year gratuity rule. Permanent staff remain under the five-year norm, making this benefit exclusive to India's expanding fixed-term workforce.

From gratuity to gig worker insurance: What new labour laws mean for employeesFrom gratuity to insurance and safer workplaces, the new rules expand what employees can expect from their jobs. Staying informed will help workers make the most of these changes.

Fixed-term employees to get gratuity after 1 year of service under new labour lawsAccording to the Union Labour Ministry, the restructuring is aimed at ensuring better wages, wider social security coverage and improved health-related protections for workers across sectors.

Sensex tumbles 400 points, Nifty ends above 26,000 amid volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex fell more than 400 points to close at 85,231, while the NSE Nifty50 managed to stay above the 26,000 mark despite broad-based weakness across sectors.

Government implements four labour codes, replacing 29 old laws. Check detailsThe move brings together decades-old labour rules that were scattered across multiple legislations into a consolidated framework. Many of these older laws date back to the pre-Independence and early post-Independence era.

Rupee slides to record low of Rs 89.45 amid US-India trade uncertaintyThe outlook for the rupee remains uncertain as global risk sentiment stays fragile and investors wait for clearer signals from both the Fed and ongoing trade negotiations between Washington and New Delhi.

Sudeep Pharma IPO fully subscribed on day 1. Check latest GMP and otherThe issue, priced between Rs 563 and Rs 593, saw a clear surge from retail and high-net-worth investors, allowing the company to cross the one-time subscription mark even though institutional participation remained weak through the first session.

How GMP and social media hype mislead so many first-time investorsThe Great IPO Gamble series ends here, and in part 3, we break down how GMP and social media hype influence first-time investors. A look at the noise behind the numbers.

Recipe for trouble? Zomato's customer data move stirs up controversyZomato controversy: Food delivery giant Zomato has decided to share customer data with restaurants after years of tussle. Politicians and marketing gurus have called it a recipe for trouble, expressing concerns about data privacy and spam messages.

Russian Oil: Reliance Halts Russian Crude Imports at Jamnagar SEZ RefineryThis report covers Reliance Industries' decision to halt the import of Russian crude oil for its export-oriented refinery in Jamnagar, Gujarat. The move is in compliance with European Union and United States sanctions targeting Russian oil majors Rosneft and Lukoil, with a wind-down period ending November 21. Reliance stated, 'we'll stay aligned with government's policy.' The company will now source crude from other regions, including West Asia and the EU, for its Special Economic Zone (SEZ) refinery, with all exports to be derived from non-Russian oil starting December 1. The decision impacts a long-term deal between Reliance and Rosneft for the supply of crude oil.

entertainment.headline: Laalo... box office: Rs 50-lakh film's 14,000% profit shakes up Gujarati cinema Gujarati blockbuster 'Laalo – Krishna Sada Sahaayate' continues its record-breaking run, racing toward the Rs 100 crore mark. The small-budget film has already delivered an unprecedented 14,000% profit, rewriting box office history in Gujarat.

Why One Piece remains the ultimate treasure hunt anime of all time In this week's Animania, we explore why 'One Piece' stands as the ultimate treasure hunt anime, blending epic world-building, mystery, emotion, and unforgettable characters in one iconic adventure.

German actor Udo Kier, known for Blood for Dracula and Ace Ventura, dies at 81 Udo Kier, celebrated for his unique roles in European and Hollywood cinema and his partnerships with notable directors, has died at the age of 81, according to his partner Delbert McBride.

Watch Dhanush made a surprise appearance at AR Rahman's concert in Pune on Sunday, performing the track 'Usey Kehna' from the upcoming film 'Tere Ishk Mein'. The event, attended by over 20,000 fans, featured exclusive live music and announcements tied to the film's release.

Gal Gadot underwent emergency surgery for massive brain clot while pregnant Gal Gadot has shared details of her emergency brain surgery after being diagnosed with a massive clot while eight months pregnant with her fourth child.

Kevin Spacey denies rumours about being homeless, clarifies his living situation Actor Kevin Spacey addresses recent speculation about his living circumstances, refuting misleading headlines and explaining his current lifestyle, while receiving support from colleagues and fans.

Rebel Saab: Prabhas charms us all with mass dance in The Raja Saab first single The team of 'The Raja Saab' launched its first single 'Rebel Saab' at a fan event in Hyderabad, marking Prabhas's return to the dance floor and highlighting nostalgic elements for fans. Composer Thaman S described the track as a tribute to Prabhas and his screen presence.

RM time to disband BTS joke explained the real story behind his chat with Jimin BTS members RM and Jimin joked about disbanding during a recent livestream, referencing a temporary low viewer count as they interacted with fans ahead of their anticipated March 2026 album release.

Kyunki Saas Bhi... actor Ashlesha Savant marries Sandeep after 23 years of dating Television actors Ashlesha Savant and Sandeep Baswana got married in an intimate ceremony at the Chandrodaya temple in Vrindavan on November 16, following a 23-year relationship.

JLo raises toast, sets Udaipur wedding ablaze with hits and stunning looks Grammy-winning artist Jennifer Lopez brought a vibrant close to the wedding festivities of Billionaire Netra Mantena in Udaipur, captivating guests with a medley of her popular tracks, dynamic dance routines, and multiple striking outfit changes.

Saying star kids have it easy is stupid: Meezaan Jafri on groupism, opportunities In an exclusive interview with us, Meezaan Jafri opened up about the biggest myths around nepotism and why calling star-kids privileged is "stupid." Taylor Swift reportedly a high-risk target ahead of wedding to Travis Kelce Singer Taylor Swift's security team is reportedly on high alert as she and Travis Kelce prepare for their upcoming wedding, with concerns rising over potential risks due to the singer's high profile and public appearances.

Rebel Wilson breaks silence after costar sues her over harassment report Actor Rebel Wilson has publicly addressed her legal dispute with 'The Deb' star Charlotte MacInnes, following allegations of sexual harassment involving producer Amanda Ghost.

Donald Glover opens up about stroke and heart condition that halted tour Singer Donald Glover has spoken publicly about the health challenges that forced him to halt his The New World Tour in 2024, revealing he suffered a stroke and underwent heart surgery. David Harbour says Stranger Things shattered his idea of who he'd become Actor David Harbour discusses his evolving career, the impact of 'Stranger Things,' and the creative journey with the Duffer brothers, highlighting the shifts in both the series and his own approach over five seasons.

general news.headline: Arunachal is part of China: Indian woman 'harassed' at Shanghai airportPrema Wangjom Thongdok, an Arunachal Pradesh–born UK resident, alleged that Chinese immigration officials at Shanghai Pudong Airport declared her Indian passport invalid, detained her for hours, and delayed her travel to Japan.

Delhi air pollution protest takes a turn, Maoist Madvi Hidma's posters on displayOn Sunday evening, the protesters at India Gate tried to block traffic and allegedly pepper-sprayed police officers attempting to disperse them, leading to an FIR and a wider probe into how the Madvi Hidma posters surfaced at the demonstration.

Shocking decision to continue: US pilot quits Dubai air show after Tejas crashWing Commander Namansh Syal died after his Tejas fighter jet crashed during a manoeuvre at the Dubai Air Show, prompting a US Air Force pilot to question why the event's flying schedule continued.

India denied, but Mohsin Naqvi hands Pakistan Asia Cup trophyMohsin Naqvi handed the trophy to Pakistan A after they won the Rising Stars Asia Cup title after beating Bangladesh A in the thrilling final that went into the Super Over in Doha on Sunday. India isn't rushing into US trade deal. What's behind the confidence?A resilient domestic economy and a lower-than-expected hit on exports to the US is giving India the confidence to look Washington DC in the eye for a trade deal. On top of that, the inflation in the US forced the Trump administration to remove punitive tariffs on several products, which will benefit Indian exporters.

South Africa 1-0 India? Why a draw is likely in Guwahati Test Senuran Muthusamy and Marco Jansen have not just saved South Africa - they have slowed time in Guwahati. Their defiant stand has blunted India's attack, drained overs from the day, and kept the pitch looking flatter than ever. With the clock slipping away and neither side able to force a breakthrough, this Test now appears to be drifting toward an inevitable draw.

Lionel Messi powers Inter Miami to 1st East final, thrash Cincinnati in semis Inter Miami progressed to their first-ever Eastern Conference final following a commanding 4–0 victory over FC Cincinnati. Lionel Messi led with one goal and three assists, while Tadeo Allende and Mateo Silvetti contributed crucial goals. Miami continues their historic playoff run and will next face either Philadelphia or NYCFC.

India bowlers worked hard but South Africa's 489 is too many: Cheteshwar PujaraIND vs SA: Cheteshwar Pujara believes India's bowlers did their job early but let the game slip away. On a flat Guwahati pitch, South Africa's 489 has created a massive mountain for the hosts to climb.

KL Rahul to Captain India in ODIs vs South Africa | Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in SquadThis special report covers the selection of KL Rahul as the captain for the Indian cricket team's upcoming ODI series against South Africa, starting November 29. The squad, announced by the Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee, includes senior players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. The report notes the committee 'opted to hand Rahul the captaincy even though Rohit Sharma was available to act as stand-in skipper'. Rahul's appointment comes as regular captain Shubman Gill was ruled out due to a neck injury sustained during a Test match. The team composition also sees pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj being rested for the series, while all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been brought in as a replacement for Akshar Patel.

R Ashwin tears into England's Bazball approach: How reckless can you be?Ravichandran Ashwin has criticised England's Bazball approach after their batting collapse in the first Ashes Test in Perth. Ashwin questioned whether high-risk batting is being wrongly justified as positive intent.

Real Madrid apologise to Elche's Andre Silva over Diogo Jota obituary confusionReal Madrid issued an apology after mistakenly using the wrong Andre Silva's image in a tribute video. The mix-up, made during a memorial segment, was quickly acknowledged and publicly corrected by the club.

Watch: India Blind team imitates Harmanpreet's iconic celebration after World Cup winIndia's blind women's team lifted the T20 World Cup in style, mirroring Harmanpreet Kaur's iconic celebration and dominating Nepal with a clinical all-round performance led by Phula Saren's match-winning heroics.

Smriti Mandhana's Wedding Postponed Due To Father's Medical EmergencyThis special report covers the indefinite postponement of Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana's wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal. The decision was made following a medical emergency involving her father, Shrinivas Mandhana, who was hospitalised on the morning the ceremony was scheduled to take place. The report states, 'Smriti Mandana has decided that until her father recovers, the wedding which was supposed to happen today will be postponed indefinitely'. The segment includes live inputs from India Today's Nitin Srivastava, who confirms that Mandhana's father is under observation and undergoing tests. The family has requested privacy as they focus on his recovery.
